base_note.note_text:
BLVR PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-04-03
Patient: Walter Peterson | MRN: 6504899 | Age: 67M
Attending: Dr. Sarah Kim, MD
Location: Temple University Hospital, Philadelphia, PA

INDICATION: Severe heterogeneous emphysema, upper lobe predominant, hyperinflation with RV 240%. FEV1 28% predicted. CT shows intact fissures. Candidate for endobronchial valve therapy (BLVR).

PROCEDURE: 
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Chartis collateral ventilation assessment (LUL)
3. Endobronchial valve placement (LUL)

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia

CHARTIS ASSESSMENT:
LUL evaluated using Chartis system via balloon catheter at LB1+2 combined orifice:
- Adequate seal obtained
- Measurement duration: 5 minutes
- Flow pattern: Decreasing to zero
- Result: CV NEGATIVE (favorable for valve therapy)

VALVE PLACEMENT:
Based on CV negative result and CT planning, Zephyr valves (Pulmonx) placed:
1. LB1+2: Zephyr 5.5mm - deployed, seal confirmed
2. LB3: Zephyr 5.0mm - deployed, seal confirmed  
3. LB4+5 (Lingula): Zephyr 4.0-LP - deployed, seal confirmed
4. LB6: Zephyr 5.5mm - deployed, seal confirmed

Total: 4 Zephyr valves placed in complete LUL lobar occlusion

Post-procedure bronchoscopy confirmed all valves seated with no visible air leak.

COMPLICATIONS: None
DISPOSITION: Admit overnight for pneumothorax monitoring. CXR q6h x 24hr.

FOLLOW-UP: CT chest in 6-8 weeks, PFTs at 3 months, 6 months.

Dr. Sarah Kim, MD

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: Severe heterogeneous emphysema, upper lobe predominant, intact fissures

code_rationales.31651: Additional valves in same lobe (add-on) x3
code_rationales.31634: Chartis CV assessment - NCCI allows separate reporting when performed in non-target lobe or distinct service

coding_review.overall_assessment: True BLVR for emphysema with Chartis assessment and complete lobar occlusion.

Bronchoscopy; with endobronchial valve placement, each additional bronchus (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with balloon occlusion, assessment of air leak, airway sizing, and documentation

variations.note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Anthony Carter
Medical Record Number: 5373775
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2025-11-22

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with severe heterogeneous emphysema - blvr candidate. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Blvr:
Endobronchial valve deployment was performed following comprehensive collateral ventilation assessment to ensure treatment candidacy. 

INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 31647, 31651, 31634

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE - CODING DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

Patient: David Ruiz | MRN: 5035668 | DOS: 2024-08-22

CPT CODE JUSTIFICATION
----------------------------------------

CPT 31647:
  Rationale: BLVR valve placement, initial lobe
  Facility RVU: 11.15
  Facility Payment: $361

CPT 31651:
  Rationale: Additional valves in same lobe (add-on) x3
  Facility RVU: 12.84
  Facility Payment: $414

CPT 31634:
  Rationale: Chartis CV assessment - NCCI allows separate reporting when performed in non-target lobe or distinct service
  Facility RVU: 1.85
  Facility Payment: $61

DOCUMENTED TECHNIQUES AND EQUIPMENT
----------------------------------------

  • CHARTIS
  • Chartis
  • Zephyr 4
  • Zephyr 5
  • Zephyr valves

PROCEDURE-SPECIFIC DOCUMENTATION:

BLVR:
  - Indication: Emphysema - lung volume reduction
  - Valve Type: Zephyr (Pulmonx)
  - Number Of Valves: 4
  - Target Lobes: ['LUL']
  - Chartis Performed: True
  - Chartis Result: CV Negative

TOTAL RVU SUMMARY:
----------------------------------------
  Total Facility RVU: 25.84
  Total Facility Payment: $836

Documentation supports medical necessity and procedure complexity as coded.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-01-07
Patient: Nathan Carter
MRN: 7830206
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
General

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Blvr performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
As documented above

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 31647, 31651, 31634

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-01-09, Brian Clark, a None-year-old patient (MRN 6415861), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for Severe heterogeneous emphysema - BLVR candidate. The patient received General and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included blvr. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is emphysema. 

Procedural coding: 31647, 31651, 31634.

BLVR PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-04-06
Patient: Austin Cook | MRN: 5613552 | Age: 67M
Attending: Dr. Sarah Kim, MD
Location: Temple University Hospital, Philadelphia, PA

INDICATION: Severe heterogeneous emphysema, upper lobe predominant, hyperinflation with RV 240%. FEV1 28% predicted. CT shows intact fissures. Candidate for endobronchial valve therapy (BLVR).

PROCEDURE: 
1. Flexible bronchoscopy
2. Chartis collateral ventilation assessment (LUL)
3. Endobronchial valve placement (LUL)

ANESTHESIA: General anesthesia

CHARTIS ASSESSMENT:
LUL evaluated using Chartis system via balloon catheter at LB1+2 combined orifice:
- Adequate seal collected
- Measurement duration: 5 minutes
- Flow pattern: Decreasing to zero
- Result: CV NEGATIVE (favorable for valve therapy)

VALVE PLACEMENT:
Based on CV negative result and CT planning, Zephyr valves (Pulmonx) positioned:
1. LB1+2: Zephyr 5.5mm - positioned, seal corroborated
2. LB3: Zephyr 5.0mm - positioned, seal corroborated  
3. LB4+5 (Lingula): Zephyr 4.0-LP - positioned, seal corroborated
4. LB6: Zephyr 5.5mm - positioned, seal corroborated

Total: 4 Zephyr valves positioned in complete LUL lobar occlusion

Post-procedure bronchoscopy corroborated all valves seated with no visible air leak.

COMPLICATIONS: None
DISPOSITION: Admit overnight for pneumothorax monitoring. CXR q6h x 24hr.

FOLLOW-UP: CT chest in 6-8 weeks, PFTs at 3 months, 6 months.

Dr. Sarah Kim, MD
